page.title: 05Housing in the Consall area
page.content: Due to drastic increases in population housing projects are now being developed on a large scale. Most houses in Britain are now built on a large estates. There are of various designs but often have small gardens. Housing in the Wetley Rocks and Consall area differs from this as it is a rural area.Many of the houses are dated farm houses which are large and generally old the oldest dating from Tudor times. In the village housing again is generally older than in the city with Terraces and Detached houses often being built of local stone. Some modern houses do exist but have been well planned not to exist but they have been well planned not to spoil the character of the village.It is hoped that this policy will continue in the future.
